actions.subcommittee: Intellectual Property, Competition and the Internet

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Intellectual Property, Competition and the Internet

official_title: To provide certain counties with the ability to receive television broadcast signals of their choice.
short_title: Four Corners Television Access Act of 2012

summary.text: Four Corners Television Access Act of 2012 - Amends federal copyright law and the Communications Act of 1934 to allow satellite carriers or cable operators to offer certain Colorado-based television broadcast stations to eligible Colorado counties located in a New Mexico-based designated market area if the counties meet specified criteria according to Nielsen Media Research statistics.

titles.title: Four Corners Television Access Act of 2012
To provide certain counties with the ability to receive television broadcast signals of their choice.
